      • div

        public void div()
        Divides a by b. a and b must be loaded before execution. Result of operation can be retrieved with getRes(). 
          Calculator calc = new Calculator();
  calc.setA(6);
  calc.setB(2);
  System.out.prinln(calc.getRes()); // Outputs 3
        Throws:
        ArithmeticException - If property b is set to 0, causing a division by zero exception.
        See Also:
        setA(int), setB(int), getRes()

      • getA

        public int getA()

      • setA

        public void setA(int a)

      • getB

        public int getB()

      • setB

        public void setB(int b)
        Sets the value for the second operator. If this value is zero, the div() method will raise an Exception.
        Parameters:
        b - The new value for the second operator.

      • getRes

        public int getRes()
        Returns:
        The result of the last operation.
